It was the third-most watched U.S. broadcast ever.

context: For the third straight season, the number one seeds from both conferences met in the Super Bowl. The Carolina Panthers became one of only ten teams to have completed a regular season with only one loss, and one of only six teams to have acquired a 15–1 record, while the Denver Broncos became one of four teams to have made eight appearances in the Super Bowl. The Broncos made their second Super Bowl appearance in three years, having reached Super Bowl XLVIII, while the Panthers made their second Super Bowl appearance in franchise history, their other appearance being Super Bowl XXXVIII. Coincidentally, both teams were coached by John Fox in their last Super Bowl appearance prior to Super Bowl 50.
modContext: In a trend that has continued for three consecutive seasons, the top-ranked teams from both conferences came face to face in the Super Bowl..The Carolina Panthers made history as they joined an exclusive group of only ten teams to finish a regular season with just one loss. Additionally, they achieved a remarkable 15-1 record, placing them among the elite few teams to accomplish this feat. On the other hand, the Denver Broncos solidified their place in football history by becoming one of four teams to have made eight appearances in the Super Bowl..The Broncos advanced to their second Super Bowl in three years after previously making it to Super Bowl XLVIII. Similarly, the Panthers also made their second Super Bowl appearance, with their first being in Super Bowl XXXVIII, marking a milestone in the history of their franchise..Interestingly, both teams had the guidance of John Fox when they last appeared in the Super Bowl before Super Bowl 50..
question: how many nfl teams have gone 15-1 in one season?
answer: six nfl teams have gone 15-1 in one season
modAnswer: the text does not provide information on how many nfl teams have gone 15-1 in one season

context: Despite waiving longtime running back DeAngelo Williams and losing top wide receiver Kelvin Benjamin to a torn ACL in the preseason, the Carolina Panthers had their best regular season in franchise history, becoming the seventh team to win at least 15 regular season games since the league expanded to a 16-game schedule in 1978. Carolina started the season 14–0, not only setting franchise records for the best start and the longest single-season winning streak, but also posting the best start to a season by an NFC team in NFL history, breaking the 13–0 record previously shared with the 2009 New Orleans Saints and the 2011 Green Bay Packers. With their NFC-best 15–1 regular season record, the Panthers clinched home-field advantage throughout the NFC playoffs for the first time in franchise history. Ten players were selected to the Pro Bowl (the most in franchise history) along with eight All-Pro selections.
modContext: Despite the release of veteran running back DeAngelo Williams and the injury of top wide receiver Kelvin Benjamin in the preseason, the Carolina Panthers had an outstanding regular season, achieving their best performance in franchise history. This accomplishment placed them among the elite group of only seven teams to win at least 15 games during a regular season since the NFL adopted a 16-game schedule in 1978..Carolina's impressive season began with a remarkable 14–0 record. This outstanding start not only established new franchise records for the best start and longest winning streak in a single season, but also marked the best start to a season by any NFC team in NFL history. This remarkable achievement surpassed the previous record of 13–0 held jointly by the 2009 New Orleans Saints and the 2011 Green Bay Packers..For the first time in franchise history, the Panthers secured home-field advantage throughout the NFC playoffs with their impressive 15-1 regular season record, the best in the NFC..A total of ten players, the highest number ever for the franchise, were chosen for the Pro Bowl, in addition to earning eight All-Pro selections..
question: what panther tore his acl in the preseason?
answer: the panther who tore his acl in the preseason was kelvin benjamin
modAnswer: the context does not provide information on any carolina panthers player tearing their acl in the preseason

context: The Panthers offense, which led the NFL in scoring (500 points), was loaded with talent, boasting six Pro Bowl selections. Pro Bowl quarterback Cam Newton had one of his best seasons, throwing for 3,837 yards and rushing for 636, while recording a career-high and league-leading 45 total touchdowns (35 passing, 10 rushing), a career-low 10 interceptions, and a career-best quarterback rating of 99.4. Newton's leading receivers were tight end Greg Olsen, who caught a career-high 77 passes for 1,104 yards and seven touchdowns, and wide receiver Ted Ginn, Jr., who caught 44 passes for 739 yards and 10 touchdowns; Ginn also rushed for 60 yards and returned 27 punts for 277 yards. Other key receivers included veteran Jerricho Cotchery (39 receptions for 485 yards), rookie Devin Funchess (31 receptions for 473 yards and five touchdowns), and second-year receiver Corey Brown (31 receptions for 447 yards). The Panthers backfield featured Pro Bowl running back Jonathan Stewart, who led the team with 989 rushing yards and six touchdowns in 13 games, along with Pro Bowl fullback Mike Tolbert, who rushed for 256 yards and caught 18 passes for another 154 yards. Carolina's offensive line also featured two Pro Bowl selections: center Ryan Kalil and guard Trai Turner.

context: The Broncos' defense ranked first in the NFL yards allowed (4,530) for the first time in franchise history, and fourth in points allowed (296). Defensive ends Derek Wolfe and Malik Jackson each had 5½ sacks. Pro Bowl linebacker Von Miller led the team with 11 sacks, forced four fumbles, and recovered three. Linebacker DeMarcus Ware was selected to play in the Pro Bowl for the ninth time in his career, ranking second on the team with 7½ sacks. Linebacker Brandon Marshall led the team in total tackles with 109, while Danny Trevathan ranked second with 102. Cornerbacks Aqib Talib (three interceptions) and Chris Harris, Jr. (two interceptions) were the other two Pro Bowl selections from the defense.
